definition: permanent/constant/fixed/usual/ordinary/rule (old)/one of the 64 hexagrams of the Book of Changes (䷟)

sentences.english: The Snow World wrote by Kawabata Yasunari is a famous masterpiece with unvarying artistic fascination.
sentences.chinese: 川端康成的《雪國》是一部具有恆久藝術魅力的名作。

sentences.english: Smoother than shells continually polished by the sea.
sentences.chinese: 比那恆久地被海浪摸挲的貝殼還要細膩。

sentences.english: Curiosity is one of the permanent and certain characteristics of a vigorous intellect.
sentences.chinese: 好奇心是構成智慧的一項恆久不變的重要特徵。

sentences.english: Meaning, on the other hand, is enduring.
sentences.chinese: 而人生意義卻是恆久的。

sentences.english: Plain Maple has an eternal charm to intoxicate us.
sentences.chinese: 清楓有一種恆久的魅力，足以讓我們爲之沉醉。

sentences.english: Diamond is the symbol of love. Diamond is forever.
sentences.chinese: 鑽石是愛的象徵，鑽石恆久遠。

sentences.english: We believe fervent and unceasing prayer should under-gird all our ministries and personal life.
sentences.chinese: 我們相信火熱與恆久的禱告是我們事奉與生活的根基。

sentences.english: Inspiration and character that seem beyond time.
sentences.chinese: 恆久的靈感與個性穿越時光隧道。

sentences.english: The topic about human beings is an old but often changing, long-lasting philosophical topics.
sentences.chinese: 人的問題是一個古老而常新，恆久而不廢的哲學問題。

sentences.english: The long illness hadvertising wasted the old manas strength.
sentences.chinese: 恆久生病消耗了這老人的膂力。

sentences.english: If you walk due north, your direction is constant.
sentences.chinese: 你如照直向北走，你的方向是恆久不變的。

sentences.english: I keep the speed of my car constant.
sentences.chinese: 我使我的汽車速度恆久不變。

sentences.english: Our gratitude is rooted in the permanent and not ever-changing landscape of our lives.
sentences.chinese: 我們的感激之心深深地根植於我們恆久不變的存在中。

sentences.english: But you like none, none you, for constant heart.
sentences.chinese: 但無一擁有你的恆久丹心。

sentences.english: Failure to express negative feelings perpetuates the withdrawal of love units.
sentences.chinese: 不能表達消極情感是愛的恆久障礙。

definition: eternal/everlasting/fig. to pass into eternity (i.e. to die)
to hold fast to/to stick to
to merge together (idiom); to unify disparate elements into one whole
to reincarnate/reincarnation (Buddhism)/(of the seasons etc) to follow each other cyclically/cycle/CL:個|个[ge4]
main part/torso/the thing in itself/noumenon (object of purely intellectual perception according to Kant)
